speaker: JULIET
text_entry: SCENE III. Friar Laurence's cell.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Enter FRIAR LAURENCE

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Romeo, come forth; come forth, thou fearful man:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Affliction is enamour'd of thy parts,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: And thou art wedded to calamity.

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Enter ROMEO

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Father, what news? what is the prince's doom?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: What sorrow craves acquaintance at my hand,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: That I yet know not?

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Too familiar

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Is my dear son with such sour company:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: I bring thee tidings of the prince's doom.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: What less than dooms-day is the prince's doom?

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: A gentler judgment vanish'd from his lips,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Not body's death, but body's banishment.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Ha, banishment! be merciful, say 'death;'

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: For exile hath more terror in his look,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Much more than death: do not say 'banishment.'

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Hence from Verona art thou banished:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Be patient, for the world is broad and wide.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: There is no world without Verona walls,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: But purgatory, torture, hell itself.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Hence-banished is banish'd from the world,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And world's exile is death: then banished,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Is death mis-term'd: calling death banishment,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Thou cutt'st my head off with a golden axe,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And smilest upon the stroke that murders me.

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: O deadly sin! O rude unthankfulness!

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Thy fault our law calls death; but the kind prince,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Taking thy part, hath rush'd aside the law,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: And turn'd that black word death to banishment:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: This is dear mercy, and thou seest it not.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: 'Tis torture, and not mercy: heaven is here,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Where Juliet lives; and every cat and dog

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And little mouse, every unworthy thing,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Live here in heaven and may look on her;

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: But Romeo may not: more validity,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: More honourable state, more courtship lives

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: In carrion-flies than Romeo: they my seize

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: On the white wonder of dear Juliet's hand

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And steal immortal blessing from her lips,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Who even in pure and vestal modesty,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Still blush, as thinking their own kisses sin;

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: But Romeo may not; he is banished:

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Flies may do this, but I from this must fly:

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: They are free men, but I am banished.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And say'st thou yet that exile is not death?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Hadst thou no poison mix'd, no sharp-ground knife,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: No sudden mean of death, though ne'er so mean,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: But 'banished' to kill me?--'banished'?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: O friar, the damned use that word in hell;

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Howlings attend it: how hast thou the heart,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Being a divine, a ghostly confessor,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: A sin-absolver, and my friend profess'd,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: To mangle me with that word 'banished'?

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Thou fond mad man, hear me but speak a word.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: O, thou wilt speak again of banishment.

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: I'll give thee armour to keep off that word:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Adversity's sweet milk, philosophy,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: To comfort thee, though thou art banished.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Yet 'banished'? Hang up philosophy!

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Unless philosophy can make a Juliet,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Displant a town, reverse a prince's doom,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: It helps not, it prevails not: talk no more.

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: O, then I see that madmen have no ears.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: How should they, when that wise men have no eyes?

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Let me dispute with thee of thy estate.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Thou canst not speak of that thou dost not feel:

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Wert thou as young as I, Juliet thy love,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: An hour but married, Tybalt murdered,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Doting like me and like me banished,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Then mightst thou speak, then mightst thou tear thy hair,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And fall upon the ground, as I do now,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Taking the measure of an unmade grave.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Knocking within

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Arise; one knocks; good Romeo, hide thyself.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Not I; unless the breath of heartsick groans,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Mist-like, infold me from the search of eyes.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Knocking

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Hark, how they knock! Who's there? Romeo, arise;

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Thou wilt be taken. Stay awhile! Stand up;

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Knocking

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Run to my study. By and by! God's will,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: What simpleness is this! I come, I come!

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Knocking

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Who knocks so hard? whence come you? what's your will?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: [Within]  Let me come in, and you shall know

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: my errand;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: I come from Lady Juliet.

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Welcome, then.

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Enter Nurse

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: O holy friar, O, tell me, holy friar,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Where is my lady's lord, where's Romeo?

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: There on the ground, with his own tears made drunk.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: O, he is even in my mistress' case,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Just in her case! O woful sympathy!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Piteous predicament! Even so lies she,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Blubbering and weeping, weeping and blubbering.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Stand up, stand up; stand, and you be a man:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: For Juliet's sake, for her sake, rise and stand;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Why should you fall into so deep an O?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Nurse!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Ah sir! ah sir! Well, death's the end of all.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Spakest thou of Juliet? how is it with her?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Doth she not think me an old murderer,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Now I have stain'd the childhood of our joy

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: With blood removed but little from her own?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Where is she? and how doth she? and what says

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: My conceal'd lady to our cancell'd love?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: O, she says nothing, sir, but weeps and weeps;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: And now falls on her bed; and then starts up,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: And Tybalt calls; and then on Romeo cries,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: And then down falls again.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: As if that name,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Shot from the deadly level of a gun,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Did murder her; as that name's cursed hand

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Murder'd her kinsman. O, tell me, friar, tell me,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: In what vile part of this anatomy

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Doth my name lodge? tell me, that I may sack

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: The hateful mansion.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Drawing his sword

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Hold thy desperate hand:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Art thou a man? thy form cries out thou art:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Thy tears are womanish; thy wild acts denote

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: The unreasonable fury of a beast:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Unseemly woman in a seeming man!

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Or ill-beseeming beast in seeming both!

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Thou hast amazed me: by my holy order,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: I thought thy disposition better temper'd.

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Hast thou slain Tybalt? wilt thou slay thyself?

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: And stay thy lady too that lives in thee,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: By doing damned hate upon thyself?

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Why rail'st thou on thy birth, the heaven, and earth?

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Since birth, and heaven, and earth, all three do meet

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: In thee at once; which thou at once wouldst lose.

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Fie, fie, thou shamest thy shape, thy love, thy wit;

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Which, like a usurer, abound'st in all,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: And usest none in that true use indeed

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Which should bedeck thy shape, thy love, thy wit:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Thy noble shape is but a form of wax,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Digressing from the valour of a man;

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Thy dear love sworn but hollow perjury,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Killing that love which thou hast vow'd to cherish;

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Thy wit, that ornament to shape and love,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Misshapen in the conduct of them both,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Like powder in a skitless soldier's flask,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Is set afire by thine own ignorance,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: And thou dismember'd with thine own defence.

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: What, rouse thee, man! thy Juliet is alive,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: For whose dear sake thou wast but lately dead;

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: There art thou happy: Tybalt would kill thee,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: But thou slew'st Tybalt; there are thou happy too:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: The law that threaten'd death becomes thy friend

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: And turns it to exile; there art thou happy:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: A pack of blessings lights up upon thy back;

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Happiness courts thee in her best array;

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: But, like a misbehaved and sullen wench,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Thou pout'st upon thy fortune and thy love:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Take heed, take heed, for such die miserable.

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Go, get thee to thy love, as was decreed,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Ascend her chamber, hence and comfort her:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: But look thou stay not till the watch be set,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: For then thou canst not pass to Mantua;

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Where thou shalt live, till we can find a time

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: To blaze your marriage, reconcile your friends,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Beg pardon of the prince, and call thee back

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: With twenty hundred thousand times more joy

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Than thou went'st forth in lamentation.

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Go before, nurse: commend me to thy lady;

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: And bid her hasten all the house to bed,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Which heavy sorrow makes them apt unto:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Romeo is coming.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: O Lord, I could have stay'd here all the night

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: To hear good counsel: O, what learning is!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: My lord, I'll tell my lady you will come.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Do so, and bid my sweet prepare to chide.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Here, sir, a ring she bid me give you, sir:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Hie you, make haste, for it grows very late.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Exit

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: How well my comfort is revived by this!

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Go hence; good night; and here stands all your state:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Either be gone before the watch be set,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Or by the break of day disguised from hence:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Sojourn in Mantua; I'll find out your man,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: And he shall signify from time to time

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Every good hap to you that chances here:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Give me thy hand; 'tis late: farewell; good night.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: But that a joy past joy calls out on me,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: It were a grief, so brief to part with thee: Farewell.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Exeunt
